questions.question_text: What files are sent to FortiSandbox for inspection in flow-based inspection mode?

choices.C: All suspicious files that match patterns defined in the antivirus profile.
choices.A: All suspicious files that do not have their hash value in the FortiGuard antivirus signature database.
choices.D: All suspicious files that are allowed to be submitted to FortiSandbox in the antivirus profile.
choices.B: All suspicious files that are above the defined oversize limit value in the protocol options.

discussion.content: D is correct, answers allowed to be sent
D is correct!
D is the correct : FGT Security 6.2 Study Guide page 470
D is the correct answer as per FGT Security 6.0 Study Guide page 438
D is answer
for me is D

choices.A: The all VDOM is not synchronized between the primary and secondary FortiGate devices.
choices.D: The FortiGate devices have three VDOMs.
choices.C: The global configuration is synchronized between the primary and secondary FortiGate devices.
choices.B: The root VDOM is not synchronized between the primary and secondary FortiGate devices.

discussion.content:
B and C 
global checksum is the same for both FGTs
root checksum of the 1st FGT is different from the root checksum of the 2nd FGT
B and C. Fortigate_Infrastructure_6.2_Study_Guide-Online p.324

discussion.content: A is correct too, right ? I see all VDOM not the same?
see https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD40284

FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.2_Study_Guide-Online (page 341).
It says:
"When DNS method is used, the browser first queries the DNS server to resolve the FQDN wpad.<local-domain>. The DNS server replies with the IP address where the PAC file is located. The browser downloads the PAC file from the URL: http://<pac-server-ip>:80/wpad.dat"

Correct answer: C
Answer is C, because the browser is quering the DNS server to resolve the FQDN. The question isn't answering about DNS server reply.

When the DNS method is used, the browser first queries the DNS server to resolve the FQDN wpad.<local-domain>. The DNS server replies with the IP address where the PAC file is located. The browser downloads the PAC file from the URL: http://<pac-server-ip>:80/wpad.dat.
Answer is C

C is correct...
The question is "query the DNS server"
The browser queries wpad.<local-domain> and DNS replies with the IP, then the browser download the pac file from http:<pac-server-ip>:80/wpad.dat

Correct Answer : C 
Explanation : When the DNS method is used, the browser first queries the DNS server to resolve the FQDN wpad.<local-domain>.

"When using DNS, the most widely supported resolution method, an entry is made in the local authoritative zone to map the name wpad (such as wpad.example.com) to one or more IP addresses. The browser is configured to automatically look in the following locations to find the WPAD configuration, which is in effect a PAC file, as described in PAC policy:"
https://help.fortinet.com/fortiproxy/11/Content/Admin%20Guides/FPX-AdminGuide/600_Objects/607_Web-proxy-global.htm
D i think is correct

questions.question_text: When using WPAD DNS method, which FQDN format do browsers use to query the DNS server?

comments.content: they have never mentioned anything about firewall policy, how we can say E Is true?
A ips sensor need a firewall policy to work... and need a policy with full inspection to inspect encripted traffic

discussion.content: E is correct

choices.E: The firewall policy is not using a full SSL inspection profile.
choices.A: The IPS filter is missing the Protocol: HTTPS option.
choices.D: A DoS policy should be used, instead of an IPS sensor.
choices.C: A DoS policy should be used, instead of an IPS sensor.
choices.B: The HTTPS signatures have not been added to the sensor.
